headline.main: XXXVth CONGRESS.........First Session.; SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. GWIN's resolution of inquiry concerning the massacre of the California emigrants in Utah, was passed. The Vice-President laid before the Senate a joint resolution of the Legislature of New-Mexico, concurring in the President's views relative to the reorganization of the Territory of Arizona, and suggesting the boundaries of the same.

docs.snippet: THE PRINCE IMPERIAL.--The Paris correspondent of the London News gives the following interesting sketch of the imperial Prince: " I have never seen it stated in print," says the writer, " that the Imperial Prince had been seen to walk alone.

docs.snippet: Very unexpectedly, Mr. HOHN HARTNETT, Secretary of the Territory of Utah, arrived in this city Saturday night, from Camp Scott. He left that post Jan, 26, bringing us news from the army two or three weeks later than our direct advices. At the time he...

headline.main: FROM THE UTAH ARMY.; Latest Intelligence from the Army at Camp Scott.

docs.abstract: Secty Hartnells' report of the State of things
docs.lead_paragraph: Very unexpectedly, Mr. HOHN HARTNETT, Secretary of the Territory of Utah, arrived in this city Saturday night, from Camp Scott. He left that post Jan, 26, bringing us news from the army two or three weeks later than our direct advices. At the time he left the entire command was in very comfortable condition, enjoying excellent health, and, considering all things, getting along pleasantly.

docs.snippet: THE LITTLE GIANT.--Mr. DOUGLAS is expected to make the closing Anti-Lecompton speech in the Senate on Monday next. Illness has kept him from his seat for several days past; but his friends at Washington report that he is in such a stage of recovery...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE LITTLE GIANT.--Mr. DOUGLAS is expected to make the closing Anti-Lecompton speech in the Senate on Monday next. Illness has kept him from his seat for several days past; but his friends at Washington report that he is in such a stage of recovery as justifies the expectation of his addressing the Senate at the conclusion of the Kansas debate.

headline.main: THE FRENCH EMPIRE.; Letter from an American upon the Condition and Prospects of the French Empire.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New York Times: Whoever has read, however cursorily, the history of France, especially if he has studied the Ancien Regime by M. ALEXIS DE TOCQUEVILLEone of her wisest teachers and the best of moncannot have failed to perceive that the era of revolutions in that country began at a period far earlier than 1789, and that,

docs.snippet: In compliance with a call of the " Sabbath Committee," a meeting was held last night in the Lectureroom of the Historical Society, for the purpose of devising means whereby " to rescue the sacred day from desecration and our City from consequent...

headline.main: Meeting in Behalf of the Christian Sabbath.

docs.lead_paragraph: In compliance with a call of the " Sabbath Committee," a meeting was held last night in the Lectureroom of the Historical Society, for the purpose of devising means whereby " to rescue the sacred day from desecration and our City from consequent demoralization." The attendance, though not exceeding two hundred persons, comprised many gentlemen of intelligence and influence.

docs.snippet: Colonel Samuel Colt, of Hartford, has purchased the famous "Charter-Oak Chair," refused by the Corporation of the City on account of its extravagant price. The Colonel paid $500. The chair is made from pieces of the Old Charter Oak, which exists no...
docs.lead_paragraph: Colonel Samuel Colt, of Hartford, has purchased the famous "Charter-Oak Chair," refused by the Corporation of the City on account of its extravagant price. The Colonel paid $500. The chair is made from pieces of the Old Charter Oak, which exists no longer, except in scattered fragments. The recusant witness Wolcott, says the Union, remains an inmate of the keeper's office at the Washington Jail, having the privilege of taking out-of-door exercise.

headline.main: Deaths of Drs. Taylor and Croswell.

docs.lead_paragraph: The death of Rev. Dr. TAYLOR has naturally created a profound sensation in this community. Though his years and failing health have given a forewarning of the inevitable result, the blow has nevertheless seemed to fall suddenly. His long services as a minister of the gospel, the position he has held for over thirty years,

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM HAVANA.; Mexican Affairs--General Concha on a Tour--Preparations for the Expected Advent of the Prince of the Asturias--Theatrical and Miscellaneous.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Spanish war steamer Francisco de Asis arrived here from Vera Cruz on the 6th inst., with the news that the town still held out against ZULOAGA'S Provisional Government. Bodies of troops had left Mexico against the rebellious Vera Cruza. nos, as the reduction of the place was considered to be of vital importance.

headline.main: Arrival of the Star of the West.; American Vessels Seized at the Chinchas. Later from New-Granada and Nicaragua. Interesting from the South Pacific. $1,279,134 in Treasure. TWO WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA.

docs.abstract: Outrage on the Dorcas C. Yeaton
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States steamship Star of the West ALFRED G. GRAY, Esq., Commanding, left Aspinwall March 6, at 4:50 P.M.,and arrived at Quarantine at 12:30 o'clock P. M. yesterday. She brings the San Francisco mails of Feb. 20, $1,279,134 In treasure on freight, and 199 passengers.
